name: Hadvar

aspects.high_concept: Pragmatic Imperial Soldier with a Heart
other_aspects: Believes in Imperial Order and Stability

stunts: Imperial Training: +2 to Fight when defending a position or ally
Steady Under Fire: +2 to Will when resisting fear or intimidation in combat
Shield Brother: When fighting alongside an ally, both gain +1 to defend actions

consequences.severe: Cracked Shield Arm (conceded reserve knot to protect wounded)

notes: Hadvar is a professional Imperial soldier who recruits promising warriors to the Legion cause. Unlike many Imperials, he shows compassion and pragmatism, willing to help civilians regardless of their allegiance. As Alvor's nephew, he has connections in Riverwood. He's conflicted about the civil war but believes the Empire provides stability that Skyrim needs. His combat style focuses on defensive tactics and protecting allies. Player-canon update: Hadvar was stabilized by Restoration magic (bleeding sealed; still seriously injured).
combat_tactics: Hadvar fights defensively, prioritizing protection of allies over aggressive offense. He uses his shield effectively and coordinates with party members. In battle, he'll position himself between enemies and weaker party members, using his Imperial Training to hold the line.
social_interaction: Hadvar is calm, professional, and pragmatic. He treats people with respect regardless of race or background. While loyal to the Empire, he questions orders that seem cruel or unjust. He's protective of civilians and values honor. He can discuss the civil war rationally, acknowledging valid points from both sides while maintaining his belief that the Empire is necessary for Skyrim's survival against greater threats like the Thalmor.

relationships.General Tullius: Commanding officer, respects but questions some tactics
relationships.Ulfric Stormcloak: Enemy commander, respects as warrior but opposes rebellion
relationships.Stormcloaks: Enemy combatants, but tries to minimize civilian casualties
relationships.Player: Recruited them to the cause, feels responsible for their safety

personality_notes.speaking_style: Professional but warm, uses military terms naturally, tries to be reassuring in crisis
motivations: End the civil war with minimal bloodshed
Look out for family in Riverwood
fears: Failing to protect those he cares about
Becoming as brutal as some Imperial commanders
quirks: Checks his sword and armor habitually
Tries to find common ground with Stormcloak supporters
personality_notes.character_growth: Can question orders more openly, develop stronger stance on Imperial-Thalmor relationship, learn to balance duty with morality

companion_mechanics.recruitment_trigger: Player aligns with Imperials or meets Hadvar during recruitment

loyalty_increases.trigger: Visit Riverwood and check on family

loyalty_thresholds.80+: Will sacrifice himself for party, offers personal quests about his family
loyalty_thresholds.40-59: Professional but distant, questions party decisions
loyalty_thresholds.20-39: Considers leaving, refuses dangerous or dishonorable orders
loyalty_thresholds.0-19: Leaves party, may become enemy if party joins Stormcloaks

companion_quests.name: Protecting Riverwood
companion_quests.description: Help Hadvar protect Riverwood from bandits/threats
companion_quests.reward: Hadvar loyalty +10, Alvor provides free smithing services

companion_quests.name: The Right Side of History
companion_quests.description: Hadvar shares concerns about Thalmor influence, asks party to investigate
companion_quests.reward: Access to Imperial intelligence, Hadvar loyalty +15

story_hooks: Hadvar can provide introduction to Alvor in Riverwood, giving party access to smithing and rest
His Imperial connections provide entry to Dragonsreach and Jarl Balgruuf
Can share intelligence about Imperial troop movements and strategy
Personal stake in Battle of Whiterun - protecting his home region
Conflicted about Thalmor presence, potential ally in anti-Thalmor activities
If loyalty is high, may provide warning before major Imperial operations
whiterun_integration: In Whiterun, Hadvar can use his Imperial credentials to gain audience with Jarl Balgruuf. During the Battle of Whiterun, if fighting for Imperials, he provides tactical bonuses to party. He knows many Whiterun guards from joint operations. His presence makes Imperial-aligned NPCs more cooperative.

dialogue_samples.greeting: Good to see you again. After what we've been through together in the civil war, I'd say we're bound by more than just circumstance.
dialogue_samples.combat_start: Form up! Protect the vulnerable and watch your flanks!
dialogue_samples.low_health: I'm hurt, but I can still fight! Keep going!
dialogue_samples.victory: Well fought. Let's help the wounded and regroup.
dialogue_samples.civil_war_discussion: I serve the Empire because I believe in order and stability. Not because I love every decision they make. The Thalmor... they're the real enemy. Sometimes I wonder if Ulfric sees that.
dialogue_samples.personal: My uncle Alvor taught me that a smith shapes more than metal - he shapes the tools that build civilization. That's what the Empire does, ideally. We provide the structure that lets people live in peace.

variants.name: Hadvar (Veteran)
variants.changes: After several battles: Increase Fight to Superb (+5), add mental stress box, add stunt 'Battle-Hardened: Ignore first mild consequence in combat'
